name: tapgreet
tag_list: mobile, local, social, vending, greeting-card, ipad, iphone, android, retail, consumer, merchandise, internet-of-things, web-of-things
overview:
Tapgreet is the next generation technology for gifting convenience, starting with boutique quality Greeting Cards. It spans both the physical and the digital world, through kiosks and apps. It envisions transforming the economy of urban retail. Our network of conveniently located self-service kiosks are rolled out in some coffeehouses around San Francisco and Berkeley. Our digital experiences cover mobile, web and kiosks.

Users select their favorite greeting card(s) in 1 minute at our kiosk (or even conveniently using their own computing device). They pay for the order, and then pick it up from the nearest kiosk right then or later at their convenience.

Retailers save 75% on traditional greeting card aisle real-estate costs when they adopt our kiosk. Publishers enjoy first-time-ever deep marketing analytics when they partner with us. And investors have their sights on our target $30B global market, $7.5B of which is in the United States alone. The Greeting Card industry, which needs to be retrofitted for the digital age, is only where we’ve begun.

For more information, visit www.tapgreet.com.

milestones.description: Paul and Amin meet over coffee for the first time and after a few hours of chatting, commit to the same vision.
milestones.source_description: Co-Founders shake hands for the first time.

milestones.description: Tapgreet launches its first experimental, honor-based, kiosks in 3 locations: Cafe Capriccio and Espresso Roma (Fillmore) in San Francisco, and Espresso Roma on College Ave. in Berkeley.
milestones.source_description: Tapgreet launches in San Francisco and Berkeley

video_embeds.description: CBS San Francisco Local News breaks the news of seeing Tapgreet kiosks pop up in various coffeeshops around the Bay Area.
